name: Southern Cheese Dip
author: Annette M
summary: I make this cheese dip all the time. Every time I bring it to a get-together, everyone wants the recipe!
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers (such as RO*TEL®), liquid drained and reserved
2 (8 ounce) packages processed cheese food (such as Velveeta ®), cut into small chunks
directions: Melt butter in a pan over medium-low heat; whisk flour into the melted butter until smooth, about 1 minute
Stir in ketchup, chili powder, and garlic powder until incorporated
Slowly stir milk into mixture until smooth
Add tomatoes with green chile peppers; whisk in processed cheese food
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly, until cheese is melted, 3 to 4 minutes
Stir in reserved juice from tomatoes if dip is too thick
